- a medium sized town in the Hamburg Metropolitan Region.

Unterweser district is in fact located outside of the Elbe-Weser Triangle, west of the Weser river.

value: Lower Saxon Wadden Sea National Park
- a part of the large national park area stretches along the North Sea shore west of

The main motorways (autobahns) in the region are A27 (Bremen - Cuxhaven) and A1 (Bremen - direction Hamburg). Another several km of motorway is between Stade and Buxtehude with another part being under construction in direction Hamburg.

Both Weser and Elbe are relatively large rivers in their lower part, therefore there are only several opportunities of crossing them using bridges. The northernmost bridge across Weser is in Bremen, however there is a tunnel under the river south of Bremerhaven. Elbe's last bridge and a tunnel before the mouth is in Hamburg.

content=The museum is located near the Nordholz Naval Airbase. It comprises of indoor and outdoor expositions and has a large collection of aircraft that has been used by the German Navy. The museum with its Cafe and a nice playground can easily be reached from motorway A27 between
and is well worth a visit for travelers with technical interests, as well as families with children. The webpage is in German only.
